questions.question: 1. In a multi-core processor, what is the primary purpose of context switching?

explanations.a: is correct. Context switching in a multi-core processor can help balance the workload between different cores, ensuring efficient utilization of resources.
explanations.b: is incorrect. Context switching does not help minimize power consumption.
explanations.c: is incorrect. Context switching does not help maximize cache utilization.
explanations.d: is incorrect. Context switching does not help enforce thread synchronization.

questions.question: 2. Which of the following data structures is commonly used to implement the process control block (PCB) during context switching?

explanations.a: is incorrect. A linked list is not a common data structure used to implement the PCB during context switching.
explanations.b: is incorrect. A stack is not a common data structure used to implement the PCB during context switching.
explanations.c: is correct. A queue is a common data structure used to implement the PCB during context switching. It allows for efficient management of processes in a first-come-first-serve order.
explanations.d: is incorrect. A binary tree is not a common data structure used to implement the PCB during context switching.

questions.question: 4. What is the primary drawback of frequent context switching in a multitasking operating system?

explanations.a: is incorrect. Context switching does not improve system responsiveness.
explanations.b: is incorrect. Context switching does not lower memory usage.
explanations.c: is correct. Context switching has a high overhead and reduces throughput.
explanations.d: is incorrect. Context switching does not enhance security.

questions.question: 5. In a preemptive multitasking environment, which scheduling policy is most likely to result in frequent context switches?

explanations.a: is correct. Round Robin scheduling is a preemptive scheduling policy that results in frequent context switches.
explanations.b: is incorrect. First Come First Serve scheduling is a non-preemptive scheduling policy that does not result in frequent context switches.
explanations.c: is incorrect. Shortest Job First scheduling is a non-preemptive scheduling policy that does not result in frequent context switches.
explanations.d: is incorrect. Priority Based scheduling is a non-preemptive scheduling policy that does not result in frequent context switches.

questions.question: 6. Which of the following mechanisms can be used to reduce the overhead of context switching in a virtual memory system?

answers.b: Reducing the number of TLB(Translation Lookaside Buffer) entries

explanations.a: is correct. Which of the following mechanisms can be used to reduce the overhead of context switching in a virtual memory system?
explanations.b: is incorrect. Reducing the number of TLB entries will increase the overhead of context switching.
explanations.c: is incorrect. Disabling demand paging will increase the overhead of context switching.
explanations.d: is incorrect. Implementing fine-grained locks will increase the overhead of context switching.

questions.question: 7. What is the primary goal of a context switch in a real-time operating system (RTOS)?

explanations.a: is incorrect. Maximizing CPU utilization is not the primary goal of a context switch in a real-time operating system.
explanations.b: is correct. The primary goal of a context switch in a real-time operating system is to meet strict timing deadlines.
explanations.c: is incorrect. Ensuring fairness among processes is not the primary goal of a context switch in a real-time operating system.
explanations.d: is incorrect. Minimizing memory usage is not the primary goal of a context switch in a real-time operating system.
